intro: Sloanea pentagona, commonly known as the five-angled sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal shape of the fruit and its compound leaves with five to seven leaflets. Sloanea pentagona typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by the unique pentagonal capsules, which are a key feature of the species.
